subject: statistics
title: Credible Intervals in Bayesian Statistics
contentHtml:
Credible intervals are a fundamental concept in Bayesian statistics, providing a range of values within which a parameter is expected to lie with a certain level of confidence.

They differ from frequentist confidence intervals in that they reflect the uncertainty in the parameter itself rather than just the sampling distribution.
